titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّ الدُّعَاءَ يَرُدُّ الْبَلَاءَ وَ الْقَضَاءَ
titles.en: Chapter 3 – The supplication can repel the affliction and the Ordainment

titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّ الدُّعَاءَ يَرُدُّ الْبَلَاءَ وَ الْقَضَاءَ
titles.en: Chapter 3 – The supplication can repel the affliction and the Ordainment

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ قَالَ سَمِعْتُهُ يَقُولُ إِنَّ الدُّعَاءَ يَرُدُّ الْقَضَاءَ يَنْقُضُهُ كَمَا يُنْقَضُ السِّلْكُ وَ قَدْ أُبْرِمَ إِبْرَاماً .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hammad Bin Usman who said, 
‘I heard him<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘The supplication repels the Ordainment and breaks it just as the rope does, and although it has been twirled and twisted (strong)’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ يَزِيدَ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ إِنَّ الدُّعَاءَ يَرُدُّ مَا قَدْ قُدِّرَ وَ مَا لَمْ يُقَدَّرْ قُلْتُ وَ مَا قَدْ قُدِّرَ عَرَفْتُهُ فَمَا لَمْ يُقَدَّرْ قَالَ حَتَّى لَا يَكُونَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hisham Bin Salim, from Umar Bin Yazeed who said, 
‘I heard Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘The supplication repels what has been Pre-determined and what has not been Pre-determined’. I said, ‘And what has been Pre-determined, I recognise it, so what has not been Pre-determined?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Until it does not happen’.

verses.text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنْ بِسْطَامَ الزَّيَّاتِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِنَّ الدُّعَاءَ يَرُدُّ الْقَضَاءَ وَ قَدْ نَزَلَ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ وَ قَدْ أُبْرِمَ إِبْرَاماً .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Safwan, from Bistam Al Zayyat, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘A supplication repels the Pre-determined (matters) and although it has descended from the sky and has been strengthened with a strengthening’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ أَبِي هَمَّامٍ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ هَمَّامٍ عَنِ الرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ الْحُسَيْنِ ( عليه السلام ) إِنَّ الدُّعَاءَ وَ الْبَلَاءَ لَيَتَرَافَقَانِ إِلَى يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ إِنَّ الدُّعَاءَ لَيَرُدُّ الْبَلَاءَ وَ قَدْ أُبْرِمَ إِبْرَاماً.

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Isa, from Abu Hammam Ismail Bin Hammad, 
(It has been narrated) from Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Ali<sup>asws</sup> Bin Al Husayn<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The supplication and the affliction would both be together up to the Day of Judgment. The supplication repels the affliction and although it has been strengthened with a strengthening’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ الْوَشَّاءِ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ كَانَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ الْحُسَيْنِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ الدُّعَاءُ يَدْفَعُ الْبَلَاءَ النَّازِلَ وَ مَا لَمْ يَنْزِلْ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Al Hassan Bin Ali Al Washa, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Ali<sup>asws</sup> Bin Al-Husayn<sup>asws</sup> was saying: ‘The supplication repels the affliction, the descended one and what has not descended yet’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ لِي أَ لَا أَدُلُّكَ عَلَى شَيْ‏ءٍ لَمْ يَسْتَثْنِ فِيهِ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) قُلْتُ بَلَى قَالَ الدُّعَاءُ يَرُدُّ الْقَضَاءَ وَ قَدْ أُبْرِمَ إِبْرَاماً وَ ضَمَّ أَصَابِعَهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Hammad Bin Isa, from Hareyz, from Zurara, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘He<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘Shall I<sup>asws</sup> point you to something which Rasool-Allah<sup>azwj</sup> did not make an exclusion in it?’ I said, ‘Yes’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘A supplication repels the Ordainment and although it has been strengthened with a strengthening’, and he<sup>asws</sup> clasped his<sup>asws</sup> fingers’ (to demonstrate it).

verses.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْوَشَّاءِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ الدُّعَاءُ يَرُدُّ الْقَضَاءَ بَعْدَ مَا أُبْرِمَ إِبْرَاماً فَأَكْثِرْ مِنَ الدُّعَاءِ فَإِنَّهُ مِفْتَاحُ كُلِّ رَحْمَةٍ وَ نَجَاحُ كُلِّ حَاجَةٍ وَ لَا يُنَالُ مَا عِنْدَ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ إِلَّا بِالدُّعَاءِ وَ إِنَّهُ لَيْسَ بَابٌ يُكْثَرُ قَرْعُهُ إِلَّا يُوشِكُ أَنْ يُفْتَحَ لِصَاحِبِهِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moalla Bin Muhammad, from Al Washha, from Abdullah Bin Sinan who said, 
‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘A supplication repels the Ordained matter what has been strengthened with a strengthening, therefore frequent from the supplications for these are the keys to every Mercy and an achievement for every need, and whatever is with Allah<sup>azwj</sup> cannot be attained except by the supplication; and there is no door which is frequently knocked upon except that it is imminent that it would be opened for its comer’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي وَلَّادٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو الْحَسَنِ مُوسَى ( عليه السلام ) عَلَيْكُمْ بِالدُّعَاءِ فَإِنَّ الدُّعَاءَ لِلَّهِ وَ الطَّلَبَ إِلَى اللَّهِ يَرُدُّ الْبَلَاءَ وَ قَدْ قُدِّرَ وَ قُضِيَ وَ لَمْ يَبْقَ إِلَّا إِمْضَاؤُهُ فَإِذَا دُعِيَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ سُئِلَ صُرِفَ الْبَلَاءُ صَرْفَةً .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Ibn Mahboub, from Abu Wallad who said, 
‘Abu Al-Hassan Musa<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Upon you is with the supplication, for the supplicating to Allah<sup>azwj</sup> and seeking to Allah<sup>azwj</sup> repels the affliction and although it has been Pre-determined and there does not remain except for its coming to pass. So when Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic is supplicated (to) and asked (from), He<sup>azwj</sup> Dismisses the affliction with a Dismissal’.

verses.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ رَفَعَهُ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ لَيَدْفَعُ بِالدُّعَاءِ الْأَمْرَ الَّذِي عَلِمَهُ أَنْ يُدْعَى لَهُ فَيَسْتَجِيبُ وَ لَوْ لَا مَا وُفِّقَ الْعَبْدُ مِنْ ذَلِكَ الدُّعَاءِ لَأَصَابَهُ مِنْهُ مَا يَجُثُّهُ مِنْ جَدِيدِ الْأَرْضِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, raising it, from Is’haq Bin Ammar who said, 
‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic Repels due to the supplication, the matter which He<sup>azwj</sup> Knows that it would be supplicated for, so He<sup>azwj</sup> would Answer; and if the servant does not supplicate in accordance to that, he would be hit from it (the affliction) what would bend his face to the earth’ (to humiliate him).
